newsitem.title: USA: Schnitzer sees lower Q2 net.
newsitem.headline: Schnitzer sees lower Q2 net.

text.p: Schnitzer Steel Industries Inc said Wednesday it expects to report fiscal second quarter earnings of $0.10 to $0.12 a share, down from $0.27 in the first quarter and $0.65 a year ago.

In a statement, the company attributed the lower results to less scrap export shipments, an $11 per ton decrease in average ferrous export selling prices, lower sales tons, and lower selling prices for its finished steel products, combined with lower earnings from non-Proler joint ventures.
"Although we are disappointed in the earnings, we continue to believe in our basic businesses and the long-term industry fundamentals," the company said.

"We anticipate improvement in our earnings in the next two quarters and throughout fiscal 1998," it said. "Ferrous scrap export selling prices on bookings so far for the third quarter are up over $13 per ton compared with the second quarter. This will help to improve our ferrous scrap margins."
Additionally, the company said it believes its new rod block, which is operational, should help increase tonnages and margins for steel operations.

"With the improvement in ferrous scrap export selling prices, we expect that our new joint ventures acquired as part of the Proler International Corp acquisition in November 1996 will also make increasingly larger contributions to our earnings over the next several quarters," it said.
